summary: This is a brief email forwarding links to the DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) report on the Jeffrey Epstein case. The email notes the report was released by Congress to media outlets, not directly by the DOJ, and provides multiple URLs where the report was posted online.

events.title: OPR Report Links Forwarded
events.description: An email is sent containing links to the OPR report on the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, noting it was released by Congress to media.

keyFacts: The DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) produced a report on the Jeffrey Epstein case.
The OPR report was not released directly by the DOJ but was released by Congress to media outlets.
The email provides multiple URLs (New York Times, Washington Post, DocumentCloud, Scribd) where the report was posted online.
The report concerns the 2006-2008 federal criminal investigation of Jeffrey Epstein by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida and its interactions with victims.
